titleStmt.title: Eiusdem ad illius interpretem, huiúsque compendij Authorem.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Eiusdem ad illius interpretem, huiúsque compendij Authorem.

monogr.title: Chronographia : A description of time, from the beginning of the vvorld, vnto the yeare of our Lord, 137. Diuided into six periodes. Wherein the seueral histories, both of the Old and new Testament are briefly comprised, and placed in their due order of yeares. Collected ou of sundrie authors, but for the greatest part, abridged and translated out of Laurentius Codomannus his Annales sacræ scripturæ

div.head: Eiusdem ad illius interpretem, huiúsque compendij Authorem.

lg.l: TVtius in Siculis peregrinus syrtib, errat,
Quàm rudis annorum Biblia sacra legit.
Sed sine naufragio fidei, nisi fallor: At esto;
nunc quiuis obeat te duce tutus iter.
Nūc mihi nec fidei, nec temporis vlla timēda
clades: tàm facile & tā breue reddis iter.
